      public static String getOrigin()
      Ex: https://developer.mozilla.org
      Returns:
      a String containing the origin of the URL, that is its scheme, its domain and its port.

      Ex: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/search?q=URL#search-results-close-container
      Returns:
      A String containing the entire URL.

    • getProtocol

      public static String getProtocol()
      Ex: https in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/search?q=URL#search-results-close-container
      Returns:
      A String containing the protocol scheme of the URL.

    • getHost

      public static String getHost()
      Ex: developer.mozilla.org:443 in https://developer.mozilla.org:443/en-US/search?q=URL#search-results-close-container
      Returns:
      A String containing the host, that is the hostname, a ':', and the port of the URL.

    • getHostname

      public static String getHostname()
      Ex: developer.mozilla.org in https://developer.mozilla.org:443/en-US/search?q=URL#search-results-close-container
      Returns:
      A String containing the domain of the URL.

      public static String getPort()
      Ex: 443 in https://developer.mozilla.org:443/en-US/search?q=URL#search-results-close-container
      Returns:
      A String containing the port number of the URL (or blank if not specified)

    • assignHref

      public static void assignHref(String href)

    • replaceHref

      public static void replaceHref(String href)

    • getPath

      public static String getPath()

    • getPathname

      public static String getPathname()
      A pathname is the portion of a URL that describes a hierarchical path, including the preceding /. For example, in http://example.com/the/path?the=query#thehash, /the/path is the pathname. It is synonymous with window.location.pathname in web browsers.
      Returns:
      A String containing an initial '/' followed by the path of the URL

    • getSearch

      public static String getSearch()
      A search is the portion of the URL that follows the pathname, including any preceding ?. For example, in http://example.com/the/path?the=query#thehash, ?the=query is the search. It is synonymous with window.location.search in web browsers.
      Returns:
      A String containing a '?' followed by the parameters of the URL.

    • getQueryString

      public static String getQueryString()
      The queryString is the part of the URL after the '?'. This is often used for parameter passing.
      Returns:
      the queryString

    • getHash

      public static String getHash()
      A hash is the portion of the URL that follows the search, including any preceding #. For example, in http://example.com/the/path?the=query#thehash, #thehash is the hash.
      Returns:
      A String containing a '#' followed by the fragment identifier of the URL.

    • getFragment

      public static String getFragment()
      The fragment is the part of the URL after the '#'. This is often used for parameter passing.
      Returns:
      the fragment
